ITdG148Mxyl6kUFwDkJbUg.text: Wow!  I can't choose between scrumptious and super yummy. The food is prepared fresh each day so itts always flavorful and attractive. The dressings are prepared on premesise and a complement to the salad or wrap or rice dish. The menu of panini, wraps, rice dishes salads provide enough variety to eat there regularly(yes.. We do!) and not get bored. Prices are reasonable and service is friendly and helpful. Highly recommend it if you are in the neighborhood of 24th street/Baseline. P.s. love The Farm panini.

Bw9NiH6rhTkJhAzQd0Jxcw.text: I was visiting a friend recently down in Arizona and wanted to grab a healthy lunch near her house.  To my surprise, there really wasn't a lot of tasty options to choose from until I stumbled upon this little gem on Yelp.  I ordered the C Square sandwich while my girlfriend got The Farm.  It was nice to see that our sandwiches both came with a side salad as well.  Both of us were in awe after taking our first bites of our sandwiches.  They were that good!  Not only that, but the side salad with the orange sesame vinaigrette dressing was superb.  We savored every bite until our plates were bone dry.  The owner, who was super friendly, even came over to chat with us and tell us about his amibtions of expanding.  Should I ever visit again, I will definitely be back here to get my fix.

LiYKr3WbTx2HnHxBzPUIvA.text: Was visiting the area last Thanksgiving and Green Mix was a slice of heaven.  My niece and I had just about every meal there for several days straight.  Loved it.  Coming back in March for a family event and will use them to cater it.

dJkdPi7WpCRDysJhyUM9XA.text: The service was excellent. Everyone was friendly and accommodating. Mom had the blue cow pannini and she's still raving about it. Sister had mango shrimp salad and I had seared citrus tuna salad. Delish! Fresh ingredients, nice dressings, and healthy portions for under 10 bucks. Thank you Green Mix!

I3DEGOW7-MWnThQNGBhsTw.text: This is a new restaurant in the neighborhood. We were hesitant at first. However, once  our salads arrived, the taste was great and the veggies on it were generous. My daughter had chicken on her salad, the chicken was an entire grilled breast, much more than expected!!! The spicy Thai salad dressing was great. We will be going back. My only suggestion would be to have more veggie options for the build it yourself salad, like cucumbers, carrots, mushrooms, etc.

7WWVjcwEbjwRbw0nE-8WbA.text: Definitely not a place I would drive over 10 minutes to eat at, but with ingredients like seared albacore tuna*, grilled ribeye steak*, smoked gouda cheese*, and lemon herb aioli, this little salad & sandwich shop is a great choice for when you are in the area. And even though the atmosphere isn't as gourmet as it's menu it's ok, because neither is the price. I'll go back. *Item listed just to give a sampling of options. I didn't actually eat this, so if it's gross and you hate it, sorry.

mLXKj_bRICTfMD51mHeu0g.text: The Mango Shrimp salad was very good!  I've had it several times, so I'll have to explore other items on the menu in the future.

C5n7cUJgG5b3GYeYKCYKyg.text: At last! A healthy option among the sea of chain fast-food places in South Phoenix.   The Green Chicken panini is so freaking good! Amazing flavors. I really love  the brown rice bowls that come with an egg.   Fresh, delicious and healthy!

sNqsyGwbc-j-pWqMW1ZFRw.text: We had the shrimp mango salad and blue cow with the sauce on the side! Soo yummy. Highly recommended!

jWJVM3UALVgKXUdQmj5UUg.text: Hidden gem warning for south Phoenicians! Healthy and great tasting food.  I took my mother out for lunch here on Christmas eve and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. They currently have a small but expanding menu, but if what they have is a tell of what is to come, the signs look quite delicious. I had The Pescado , which is their seared albacore panini and it had some whooping flavour for only $7.99. My mother had the chicken rice bowl, which I must say for $5.99 had some amazing value for the amount of food you get.

jZXcqVFvpJrAx4eL-w4L_g.text: I was unaware it was possible to ruin a salad so much! SO GROSS! Three of us girls in the office went to lunch here, 2 left sick & I was just left with the bad taste in my mouth. Do Not Recommend! & That makes me sad, because I'm a salad girl :/ I wanted so badly to like this place. Expensive too

pHhtye-V2k_XcWlwMSCuKg.text: Finally a new restuarant in South Phoenix..I went the other night not knowing what to expect and was very happy when I saw the inside.. the food selection was awesome..and the salad I had with the creamy horseradish dressing was wonderful.. Just enough bite to it but no over powering..  The owner John was my favorite waiter at Pan Asia and I'm glad he opened up a new place here in South Phoenix... Kudos to John and his staff.  Gary

NLMg98GoYBLpvMkg1HhsSw.text: Food is great, very fresh and great flavor, wow. Good specials too. The ordering process with filling out the order form is a little odd, but overall this place is great.

AXEzzOU93Fx2FLplMTH92Q.text: Had a chicken sandwich - it was nothing short of wonderful.  I wasn't expecting very much and I was blown away. A sandwich and a side salad included for $5.99, a good deal. All the flavors went together and I couldn't stop eating it! Will definitely be back.

F5QUW6KycB4xOX17_T9ilA.text: Wonderful staff! Delicious and healthy...can't beat it!

1BjsudmalVAQO2CoFoApiQ.text: This is a good lunch place. The other locations are equally good, but it's expensive for what you get. They need to load on the toppings a bit more. Avocado is extra even though they are currently in season. Time to get food was average, I will go back when in the area, but it's not a destination.

eWUJTzBOV9XJv4LW2NgVFg.text: Following rappelling, it was time for lunch.  We were looking for something light, healthy and filling....  Well, we found it at GreenMix.  Their portion sizes were huge.  The food was fresh, the staff was very friendly and expeditious in getting your food out... This is a great place to grab lunch on the go or stick around and eat in house..

w02fjxD2FaEhDN1EUfdO6Q.text: Great service! Great sandwich! Wrap so good my husband got a second! If you build your own salad, it can get a bit pricey adding proteins & additional toppings. We will definitely return!

o62uqA1ohZrV9tDndqWzjg.text: The homemade salad dressings make this place. The food is fresh, green, and you dont feel like you want to go confess to your priest when you are done eating.

3uLyp8d20zukzaRcYmeQSQ.text: good fresh food place. i'm not a big salad eater. but the sandwich i got was amazing. try it out, the place really wasn't for me. but it's great, go see if it's for you.

kZQUvv5gipD_pIUIk7JMAQ.text: Not blown away, but it's not terrible.  Pros: very clean, nice bright decor, local and family owned. Fresh and healthy menu.  Cons: VERY overpriced. They are really stingy with the portion sizes. I had to ask if the drink cup I received with my "special" was a water cup, it was that ridiculously small. The food is healthy but not at all flavorful.   Note: THEY DO NOT HAVE PANINIS even though it says that on the menu, which was disappointing since that's what I wanted. I don't think the owners know what a panini is honestly. You get a toasted sandwich.   I had the Green Chicken panini, which wasn't a panini at all, just a tiny toasted sandwich. It was really bland. They need to throw a little salt and some red onion on it. Something. My husband had the chicken salad wrap, which was a little tastier, but not much.  If they would season the food, up the portion sizes, switch to normal sized drink cups so I'm not insulted when they hand it to me, OR lower the prices, I would probably give it a second chance. Since my husband no longer works in the area and I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, I probably won't be back.

Photo of GreenMix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My teeny tiny drink lol

ors7vQcbBXK2hJK157Fgog.text: Can somebody say Green Chicken Panini?!!!  If you are looking for s different mix of food from your usual fast food, Green Mix is definitely a place you might want to check out & try!  I love healthy food to begin with, but this place takes a tastier spin on your usual sandwichwes, salads and wraps!  Did I tell you about their salad?  The dressing is to die for!  Only drawback is that it does take a while to receive your food.  I suggest calling beforehand.  It does get crowded during lunch time and when it is not, they are short staffed.  They give Military discounts and incentives w/a punch card.  Definitely not bad for those looking for a different & healthier alternative.  :)

mnJzHdD_CHL6RD8-IEWyKQ.text: Love this place! Healthy, delicious, no salt used, taste buds satisfied.. No joke! I thought healthy eating isn't as good as pigging out but this place.. You gotta try it!

-A41znF9E6A9YfiZ1rPdAg.text: food was fresh and delicious and very flavorful. everything on the menu sounds great! we will definitely be back! prices are pretty good except for the fact that if you order their specialty salads, just be sure you can't get the same thing on the build your own salad menu because that is the cheaper route. we got the sweet thai chicken salad that was advertised as their special for 14 something, nothing special but it was delicious! but you could have built your own salad with chicken and same dressing and added more veg for only 10. we figured this after we got our food and was a little confused and annoyed but whatever.

1FasvlGXS496l6ILY0sX6A.text: Salad snob here. I supposed it's a healthy place to eat, but it's not something I would go back to again and again. I had a Greek salad, which was okay at best. The yogurt dressing wasn't particularly flavorful, nor was the rub used on the meat. If I were on a strict diet, this place could be the one that sends me off the diet due to bad tastes.  If the dressing were better and the spices on the chicken were more apt, I think it would have been a better meal.

iCesVobPwBEPZzZweCnNsg.text: This place is awesome!! Great, healthy food (and I usually avoid that like the plague haha!).

wwzD4nXMuKyH2L5gPA7Faw.text: Salads are delicious there jumbo shrimps go perfect on top! There unique dressings to choose from Lime infused ranch was amazing!   Cons- Poor customer Service, not helpful when it comes to being undecided or asking for their recommendations

NRp0BrP85WbVW-y8iOtRvw.text: This place is horrible. They don't use gloves, don't pay attention to good service and cleanliness. They would actually rather argue with you then try to improve something or apologize. They have really gone down hill. Do yourself and family a favor and stay away. Not worth the risk of getting sick or dealing with bad service all around.

NyQNlqlv9fE9HxaxFt9cLQ.text: Terrible service!  Bad food!  Ordered a Shrimp Caesar Salad...shrimp was bad. Paid 12.99 for the salad. I took it back to the manager and ordered a build your own with no meat and she would not refund me the difference of 6.00.  So expensive and not good food! Don't waste your money!   I will never return and I will let everyone know how terrible the food and service is.

ihBeItUcLo-sBRUSjvmTjA.text: First time here and I am not impressed. I came in hungry and left sick to my stomach. After watching the lady make my chicken Cobb salad, it was absolutely gross. She used gloves (thank God) but after throwing some leaves together she just left it out in the open while flies flew around. As she went around touching trash, dirty utensils, etc she kept the same gloves on and kept wiping with what I'm assuming old dirty towels left on the counter to use for the counter, not wiping your hands. Seriously, y'all if food poisoning or the stomach flu is what you want, by all means check this place out. Not to mention... $13 for a salad? Especially in such an unsanitary place, not worth it!

fHzTLYn8ZMNZC9VjgL1URg.text: Interesting lunch spot in the South Phoenix area - I've been twice and each time I felt so proud of myself for eating so healthily!  Each time I had a salad, and they were both fresh and yummy.  Many of the dishes have an Asian influence and it's cool to see a place with a variety of tasty dishes instead of the usual humdrum lunch spots like Chipotle and Subway.  They are slightly more expensive than a typical lunch spot, but they still appear to have a loyal fan base of office workers in the area. I will definitely return the next time I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of GreenMix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch Special..Seared tuna, salad, brown rice.. $8.99

T-eCchK_t21558FT6j8TdA.text: Excellent place for healthy food! We always get the Asian BBQ beef salad with the brown rice (I hate brown rice but theirs is to die for! So tender and moist). The beef is  always delicious and their vinaigrettes are nice and tangy especially the orange.

AyejUt7IZfZcQ2qss6VNhg.text: I work nearby and don't have a lot of healthy lunch options. Good thing I have this place to go to!  I love their brown rice bowls (I've had the chicken and Korean beef, both delicious). Their salads are really yummy, too, but just not substantial enough for me. However, they have been enough for my coworkers, so maybe I just have a huge appetite. I also had this chicken greek wrap as a lunch special and it had so much flavor! It's a great place for lunch and the man, who I believe is the owner, is always very friendly!

ejf40QoLpzozIYr24GM2PQ.text: so i went to greenmix today and the experience was horrible.  owner asked me if i wanted to dine in or carry out, i replied...dine in...now i have eaten many times at this place but always have gotten a bad vibe from the owner. i normally push it to the side because she's never friendly as a business owner should be. well today what i always thought pretty much came to light. a white gentlemen was behind me in line and he was served begore me, now i just assumed his order didn't take as long but when the owner showed up to my table with a styrofoam container when i said i was dining in ..i was appalled.  i told her i wanted a plate..she insisted that i can eat from the container. i'm like, i would like a plate, she points to the white man and says..a plate like his? yes please but yet still told me i can just eat from the containeri.she snatched the container and bag and walked away. i'm like she didn't even apologize..so i requested my refund...she slammed it on counter and not placing it in my hand. no apology, no eye contact..etc.. i will never eat here again because obviously black people should eat from the containers and not there plates! sad sad sad!

zZmqAuqqB_AtPBsmULJNVg.text: Green mix is amazing!!!   The place is very clean and has friendly staff that greets you as you walk in. The menus are on the wall, you fill it out and hand it to the cashier. You can pick from their signature items that include salads, rice bowls, and paninis. Or... You can customize your own salad by choosing your greens, toppings, and dressing! I've tried many items on their menu and I have yet to dislike anything. The dressings have a lot of flavor, from sweet to savory and everything in between. By far, my favorite item is the greenmix tuna panini! To die for... You can have the tuna well done or seared. I like seared. It has Gouda cheese, fresh jalapenos (for that extra crunch), cilantro, onions, greens, and their house dressing! Perfection!! Great place for lunch or dinner!

kp2PGmKBJu6rVXK6655EDw.text: I came here for the salads.  I've been here a few times before.  There are plenty of Asian inspired salads.  I got the Asian beef salad which included spring mix, jicama, tomatoes, carrots, oranges, cilantro, panko bread crumbs and spicy ponzu vinaigrette.  The vinaigrette is delicious!  You get plenty too so you can drown the salad with the sauce if you'd like.  Surprisingly, the flavors all worked and it was quite tasty.  I would definitely get the salad again.  The price was the only thing that caught me off guard.  It was a bit expensive for the salad.

rk8dj31Hm_fMcqIlMkDx7Q.text: I ate a huge lunch so i decided to get a salad for dinner.  I thought it was a good decision but it wasen't. I'll tell ya why.  I entered around dinner time and the place was empty.  I was the only customer the entire time.  That was a bit strange but from now on, I'll trust the rule of, if your the only one there is a reason for it and leave.  So, I walked in, and held the menu for 4 minutes real time.  The guy at the counter simply looked at me silently.  Can I say "AWKWARD!"  I had no idea if it was an Asian inspired or Mediterranean type of menu.  How the heck does this place work?  I wanted a fatoosh salad but no luck so I played it safe and got a Greek salad with chicken.  I wish it would have come with some kind of bread to break up the salad texture.  To make a long story short:  Cons:  The food was a bit plain.  I could make it for $4 from frys but who wants to cook?  Not me.  It cost almost $10 for the salad alone, to go.   Small portions.  No help or customer service from the guy at the counter.  I think he wanted to continue watching his laptop.  I have to say he was polite while I ordered a basic salad with a dumb look on my face.  Hey it was a long work day.  Pros:  The woman who was cleaning and cooking was very polite and had a spark of personality.  Too bad she appeared to be doing all the work.  The store was amazingly clean, including the kitchen.  The reason for the two stars instead of one.  I love to see clean restaurants.

wLmyulYTf1pISOPNqios8w.text: I've been waiting here for half an hour. 10 minutes to order, 20 minutes to get the food. There are only 6 people in the entire place, so I thought this would be a lot faster.   When I finally got the food (a spicy something chicken bowl), it tasted like a chicken bowl lost a fight to a bottle of red wine vinegar. This would be good for someone who really likes vinegar, but that's not me.   All in all, not the worst, but definitely not worth the wait.

FBiW-oCSPGUraNFzaKkmLQ.text: GreenMix is by far my favorite place to go to for any kinds of salads and their panini's are amazing!  You're able to customize your salad to whatever you want and their dressings for the salads are awesome. I've tried their wraps with a chipotle sauce and it's delicious. They include the perfect combination of toppings like corn, pico de gallo, black beans, and cucumbers. I recently tried their grilled chicken panini and that was WOW! They put fresh grilled chicken with gouda cheese, sliced apples and avocado...nice crisp taste.   Other than their amazing food, their service is always up to par!

Zb65FFgkOkKeLyzVTAYxRg.text: Friendly staff, and excellent food. I was pleasantly surprised by the amount of chicken that was on my salad. Also the lemon slices for the tea were large. This may seem trivial but I abhor the trend of restaurants cutting the lemons into 300 small pieces to save on food costs.

NT07ZrwFS-GlREHbIMc5HQ.text: Awful. Waited around 30 minutes to never get my meal. A simple chicken sandwich. They gave me shit when I asked for a refund and when they finally gave it to me, it wasn't a full refund. Didn't even compensate me for the terrible Sprite I ordered. Zero stars would be an apt review. Don't eat here. It's a poorly run business that needs a serious makeover and customer service training.

_c4anPrQd0SfIf-aJxQuDg.text: Great place to eat friendly staff the place is clean. I don't know why some people commented the place isn't clean. The price is just right for fresh ingredients. Love it.

ya1DW0K5v7kqrhAFInoGng.text: I went here lunch and it was good but nothing special.   PROS: I liked that you can build your own salad or wrap. That is what drew me to this place. I am vegan & hate places that only offer one standard veggie option.   I liked that they had a variety of greens, nuts, fruits, etc.  The spinach wrap itself was delicious & fresh!  CONS: The price listed on the build your own wrap is kind of a scam- all proteins are extra.  No tofu, bean or other good vegan protein option.  The huge paper menus that you mark your choices on seem like a waste of paper. That's a lot of garbage being generated. Plus the food for dine in is served on paper plates. More garbage created.  OVERALL:  The wrap was good, not great & a little pricey. I would not seek out this place but if was in the area & needed lunch i might go back.

JZsmcCV_AZUe8OamHRnRIA.text: I live in the area and have walked passed this place several times. I finally go for a salad. I will just say this place is Very Unsanitary! The lady behind the counter took my order with one glove on, then proceeded to make my salad with the same glove. This place also has to much food just sitting out in the open and it's very hot inside the building.  :(

3qfZtmAbuJVqYf7oMcap0Q.text: Had the shrimp salad and absolutely loved it. We came in at closing and we were still able to order. They were quick and the food was great. I definitely will be coming back for a healthy meal.

--kzlX9DzEFo5zofgxgeVA.text: The meats are hot and tender and the greens are fresh and good quality. I always feel good mentally about what I ate and feel good physically after. It's a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for and their Daily Special is an affordable option without sacrificing size. The Korean beef is tasty and their salads offer flavorful and appealing options.    The environment is clean and kept up and the staff is helpful and attentive.   Tip: Check out the wall before you order for pictures of different items.

9co0pxFJrpzVVkSsOZjnig.text: This Place was recommended by a coworker and close to my job  I ordered a mango shrimp salad and it was amazing! The shrimp were huge and the salad dressing was Delicious I could drink it  My order was ready quick place is cute and easy

57Byvp511Vl1OxnWBNrikQ.text: I ordered the teriyaki chicken. It was mostly chicken fat.  Awful.  I did not finish it and I will not return.

urz-62Vs48qUNlyIruOpmg.text: Went here to enjoy a healthy lunch which left me with no appetite after the cash register attendant made an error and double charged my friend. After pulling up a bank statement to provide proof of double charge they proceeded to tell my friend she needed to pay and no transaction went through. As the meal was being served they took it back and told my friend to call the bank and provide proof that the statement visible on her phone wasn't enough validation. After calling and clarifying, yes the order was charged twice and hen my money was refunded; however The workers continued to argue about it as we sat and tried to eat the lunch. For the cost of the meal, and taste I wasn't too happy.

FgwhG8ePMYDCT5QRMPNdUw.text: Excellent food I come here for lunch all the time.  Please patronize so we can keep good restaurants in the neighborhood.

Cu0hRv9Xdkxjn0GImzV1cw.text: The food was light and fresh yet filling and the staff there Ellie ( ee-lee?) Was fantastic. She took our order and answered any questions we had about the menu. I settled on the brown rice bowl with jumbo shrimp and sweet chili sauce. She let us taste the sauces beforehand to ensure we got what we liked. They have awesome add ons you wouldn't expect like portobello mushrooms and ones you would like avocado. My coworker got a chicken spinach wrap with choice of 5 veggies and she had no complaints. The gal that took our order also made our food and brought it out to us. She was happy to bring us hot sauce etc. She later cleared our table. She did it all basically. I highly recommend. Don't let the shopping/strip mall surroundings deter you from a healthy well made food option.

photos.caption: Photo of GreenMix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jumbo shrimp brown rice bowl! Noms

u-3aqhVLGxY9uuQ8YAokIw.text: Stopped here for a healthy dinner and it's one of our new favorite spots in town. We'll definitely be coming back. The experience started with exceptional customer service and help with recommendations to place our order. Everything was made to order and fresh. There are many dressings to choose from, made from scratch, no MSG. The brown rice bowl with tuna, grilled veggies, and egg was delicious. The salads were extremely good and filling as well!

photos.caption: Photo of GreenMix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Build your own salad with lemon herb ranch made to order. Packed with flavor and chicken was grilled to perfection.

R0DhZIaY4Ra4yyZUQRebTQ.text: Delicious! Nutritious!   The staff was super nice and friendly the food was sooooo good! The food was fresh ! I will definitely keep coming back!   The speed was great for lunch, I was in and out in less than 10 min. Definitely come here if you have a chance

oVAXa3RHjdsDhLwouEb9nw.text: I had the asian bbq and the korean bbq panini and wow, so amazing. The beef is so soft and tender its really amazing and the sizes were great it was 21 dollars and well spent. Im a part time vegetarian and only eat meat 2 times out of the month and i feel like i made the right choice, really reccomend this place not just for the price but the quality of the food  aw well  made my tummy smile.

1ZLc8fMPH-31qyjMdcJ6rA.text: Awesome fresh salad for the price. You can make your own or have one of their creations. Same with the sandwiches. Great service too. I will keep coming back.

RzCFySyJJbbT_MLMEvm5Mw.text: Disappointing. I love the concept, but they do not execute very well. The inside really could be cleaner. Clutter on the counters and just generally a lack of pride in the eating area. Agree with other reviewers that the Hawaiian chicken is rubbery and more "fish like" in texture. Portions are decent size though. Service was okay, nothing special. Don't think i'll be back.

txYEiJevJ8vDP6mqVJ5Vvg.text: Just in town visiting and wanted a healthy option. Man I wish they had this where I live. Incredibly healthy, fresh and affordable. Many options for even picky eaters.

Qd9VYuMG2ybLInBMD9mydA.text: I love my Korean BBQ beef sandwich! The flavor is perfect, the size is enough for me. It's not too large or small. They served fast. Great place to hangout too. I would like to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of GreenMix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Korean BBQ beef

n9JjAmYBWc3pUC8HPnixLg.text: The woman at the counter was eager to help a first-timer understand the menu and how to order, despite her thick Asian accent. I had the "Daily Special" Chicken Salad Panini (pictured), but was unimpressed.  The bread wasn't at all panini-like and probably shouldn't have been warmed for a traditionally cold salad. I may try this place again but if I do, I'll stick to some other salad --- sans the warm bun.

fKR5Ctps2VHktvFiKqD9TQ.text: Best lunch in South Phoenix! Love the Korean BBQ on rice, with Spicy Ponzu. Also the Chicken Cobb Salad on the Pita is amazing! You can tell the Owner-Manager cares about what he makes and wants you to be happy!

2vK7E7zsRQfPZtEUqg74sg.text: Love the variety and freshness of the ingredients! Very good for those dieting because its all healthy foods. You cannot get these types of wraps anywhere else!

JpefSOVhWrueE-NPNaLANQ.text: Today was my second time here and this place is great. I have only had a salad and everything is so fresh. It is a little pricey but with everything so fresh and home made it is well worth it. Very healthy choices. Great spot for lunch if you are in the south mountain area.

bG57lrRj_08MmBguyQyFqQ.text: I really like this little place.  The employees are friendly, the food comes quickly and it's delicious.  The orange sesame salad dressing is sooo yummy.  I've been a few times for lunch and every time has been excellent.  They also have a frequent customer punch card so you can get some deals with that if you like coming here.  The real dishes and cutlery are a nice touch too.  My favorite sandwich is the BLTC - a BLT with smoked gouda.  I'm salivating just thinking about it.

SgAnWUssnIfHMVKbzsmBIQ.text: Oh man....I'm so happy right now!! I just tried this place for the first time; made my own steak salad. Every ingredient was delicious!! Definitely the new spot!

EwvnWEum3K3P911b4TFyxQ.text: Food is amazing. Fresh, made to order and good prices. Service is subpar at  best. Not sure if the lady owns the place or is a cashier but I have been back several times for the food and she manages to be rude, short and irritated every time.

ESGE7d1SluuAWYe-s_kkFg.text: The sign for Mixed Greens has been up for a few weeks and I have been eagerly anticipating the first time that I could go. Right now it is in a "soft opening" period where I guess they figure out what people in south phoenix like in a salad. For today I chose to get the Mango shrimp salad. It had a number of ingredients that I am a huge fan of. It had things like mango (duh) avocado, grilled shrimp (that I think they made right then) and Parmesan cheese. I am really enjoyed my salad. The dressing was tasty (I am not good at describing flavors) and a bit spicy and I ate the whole thing! It is of course brand new and so the help was incredibly friendly. They came around a few times checking to make sure that we enjoyed the food and that everything was too our liking. My wife ordered a rice bowl and it was a bit light on the sauce so he quickly brought out more! The tables were clean and it was a very open environment.   Here is the reality of this restaurant as I see it. In south phoenix we all complain a bit about the lack of choices as far as food is concerned. There are plenty of fried foods and Mexican places but nothing much after that. If you want variety and choice, supporting this place would be a great start. The food is good and the service is great. You can tell that they want to be successful by the efforts they make. If you like salad with unique flavors and awesome meats (like seared tuna, and steak) then you will probably like this place. If you don't eat here than I hope you eat dirt.

photos.caption: Photo of GreenMix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak salad
Photo of GreenMix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mango shrimp salad.
Photo of GreenMix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rice bowl with fried egg!

1uHLBlnrqomg0ZgTziezKA.text: So as anyone can see from my reviews, this is my third review of Green Mix. I went from 5 stars when they first opened down to 3 stars because they were skimping on things.  Now for an update. If I could give 4 1/2 stars I would. They have gone back to the way things were when they first opened. Better portions, fresh food & a very clean restaurant. It always makes me happy when I see restaurants take comments from Yelp and fix any problems there might be and it looks like Green Mix has done just that. Good job Green Mix you have gotten me back as a loyal customer.  A couple things I would like to see implemented. Maybe some better lunch deals, sandwich's are still a bit pricey for being next to Subway. The quality of your food blows Subway away but we are in a deep recession and a $5 foot long seems more appealing. The other thing and the BIGGEST complaint I have is NO KIDS menu. When I drive by at night the place is a ghost town and it might be because families will not come to Green Mix because of the lack of a kids menu. I know for our family, with 4 kids, you will never get our night or weekend business because there is NO KIDS menu. Why not have a grilled cheese or BLT that can be put on something other then a panini.  Other then that, good job getting the food portions and standards back to where they were when you first opened.

Rr1g6UViBFJd5zatGdwM8w.text: Not Impressed.  I had the chicken wrap. It was small. The taste was nothing special. I paid $5.99 for it and it came with a small fountain drink. The cup was like 10 ounces. Great. Now I have to get up several times to refill my drink.  Maybe other items are better? There seems to be a great deal of positive reviews so maybe I will try again. Then again, there is never anyone here. Guess I will be going to Subway instead.

8yIC2nJUNsxq67AVnoTbxw.text: I really wanted to love this place.  When I looked at the menu I was excited to get my food.  I was a bit disappointed.  It was something I could have easily thrown together at home with the same ingredients.

ghuEiLyp2Z9sB9byTiKvDA.text: I was visiting some family over thanksgiving holiday and needed something healthy to eat after gorging myself on vagina i mean vegetarian stuffing.  So I came here on Friday and had a roasted veggie salad.  It tasted really fresh and flavor was tasty without being overpowering.  So we came back on Saturday and I had a veggie Panini, again it was two thumbs up. Best Panini I have EVER had.   I don't really know Phoenix too well, but this place is definitely a gem. I do wish they had a larger salad menu.  For a name like GreenMix, they would do good to have more than 1 vegetarian salad, but they will probably expand their menu in the future, I think the place just opened.

TFeNqWnCi6_JYeUP8uXPwA.text: Love this place! I go here almost every day over my lunch hour. With a menu like this, it never gets old! And it is a much healthier alternative to the Subway that sits next door! The staff is friendly, service is fast and the food is great. Highly recommend this gem!

niP-wpCbloPv2zY6RByQVQ.text: This is a great place to eat. I have passed by this place several time and finally stopped in. I am so happy I did. I have to say for as great is this place is, I am surprised it isn't more busy.   I got this chicken, Bacon, avocado panini that was amazing it was called the C square. They use this chibata type bread that is super soft and have this lemon herb aioli that just makes this sandwich it also comes with spinach, cherry tomatoesand blue cheese but I subed that for gouda. It comes with this what seems regular spring salad but it has this Asian dressing that just pushes your plain old spring mix salad to a whole new level.   I will most definitely be going back.

qXPmROnypBCUAf6fy3Ol4g.text: I was out and hungry yet wanted to grab something more healthy than a diabetes double with cheese and low and behold I came across Green Mix in Phoenix they claim to offer modern salads, (whatever that means) and paninis. The cashier was a character and the Thai shrimp salad was something...beets red and green peppers shrimp hard boiled egg walnuts in more all up in your mouth....each bite was interesting enough that I will go back and try another salad or the green chicken panini

photos.caption: Photo of GreenMix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai shrimp salad

YAkLfDgNuH2lnJTtulbanA.text: My wife and I stopped in here on a whim and were not let down. We ordered the green chicken panini and the earthly chicken panini. Both were delicious, but we were surprised by how good the side salad was. The GreenMix house dressing was the highlight for me in the simple green salad. It has enticed me enough to try a salad on my next visit, and I have my eyes on the tender steak salad. The staff were also super nice and helpful.  This was a refreshing change of pace and a nice food option for a shopping center that only has franchise eateries in it.

os_fBPnJZmBZd1wRb4GHgw.text: My partner and I live in the neighborhood and shop at Fry's several times a week.  This place has been open a 2-3 years and today was our 3rd visit.  We won't be going back.  We are both vegetarian, I ordered the veggie panini, which isn't a panini, and he ordered a 'make your own salad'.  Add two drinks and it was $20.  Just an in our last two experiences, the portions were really small.  The salad was really a side salad spread out on a big plate.  My sandwich was pretty bland, but at least I didn't walk out of the place hungry...that came 30 minutes later.  My partner left hungry.  I love the idea of this place, and I really want to support a local family business, but you can't charge $20 for lunch and have people walk out hungry.

72S7F4topR8dYvrQjhJGXw.text: Finally a place to eat something other than fried grease or cardboard pizza in SoMo.  Everything at Green Mix is exceptionally fresh. I ordered the Walnut Chicken Salad and the Asian Chicken Salad. Everything was fresh and hand-cut right there (yes, they wear gloves!). The greens, the chicken, the apples, the walnuts, the chickpeas, ...everything was fresh, not a tinge of brown or sogginess on anything.  Dressing on both salads was fairly light and not overpowering, which is great if you want to avoid the "drowned in 1000 Islands" thing.   It's pricey if you think of it as "just salad" but the fact that it's made fresh makes it worth it. You can also make up your own salad creation, add or omit ingredients, and so forth.  The owner is a hoot.

ap8mjvH2k6nE3YwHrypYxQ.text: We were headed to Applebee's for a salad a couple of years ago and happened upon this place. The owner took our order and made our salads and was very nice. Food and service were both great!

NuMhGF2D9vrzmgS2HPibiw.text: Wish I could give it NO stars. My boyfriend and I came here for 2 reasons. 1st: He has a gluten allergy and we knew we would be safe with a salad. 2nd: There was a big sign that read: $3.99 (& up) Specials Includes Fountain Drink. So, we figured it would be a cheap lunch. We were soooooo wrong. Upon ordering, I asked what the $3.99 special was, the lady said a chicken salad sandwich. Ok, great! And it includes a fountain drink (according to the advertisment)...WRONG. Fountain drinks are another $1.95. So there is no such thing as a $3.99 special that includes a fountain drink, FALSE ADVERTISING!!! I ordered the sandwich and drink and my bf ordered a build your own salad, which had lettuce, cucumber, and onions, nothing else and no dressing and a fountain drink. Total was $15.48!!!! We are assuming we will get a fair amount of food. WRONG AGAIN. My sandwich was mostly bread and didn't have any kind of side, not even a sprig of parsley for presentation, and his salad was a handful of lettuce with 4-5 slices of cucumbers and some dry onions, probably smaller than a side salad from Wendy's. Irritated already, i took 2 bites of a crappy chicken salad sandwich and low and behold a curly black hair in the middle of the chicken salad. The lady behind the counter had kinky black hair so I knew exactly where it came from, thank God! I took the sandwich back to her and she offered to make another, I told her I just wanted my money back, she gave me back the $4. So all in all we paid $11 and some change for a ridiculous excuse for a salad and 2 sodas. And still left hungry.  I will NEVER go back here, I cringe just thinking about it. And I am pretty easy on restaurants, being that I was a server for 8 years, but this place is aweful.   STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!

aZXqPbetU5J0jxOQosN6Vg.text: Extremly rude people. I called to make an order and introduced my self they did not even give me a chance to speak and tell them I wanted an order, the lady that piced up the phone just said do not call here and hung up the phone thinking I was a telemarketer I wanted to give it a try but now I am worries of getting the same service in person. more customer service needed.

Food is okay. Place is not clean.

zkEKbMCPDsOGPMn3LkNE3w.text: I've eaten here before and their food was decent. As their name implies, they have a lot of salads or sandwiches with a lot of veggies. So it is a pretty good option if you're looking to feel a bit less-guilty about eating out. However, I recently tried to call them to place an order over the phone and no one even picked up. I tried several times and even verified the phone number on Yelp, Google, and their website. Kinda hard to do business if I can't even place an order.  Update: So apparently they closed early due to the Labor Day holiday (it's Saturday right now). However, my rating still stands since there was nothing about this posted on their website and no message when I called. Either of these could have been done with minimal effort.

ABpSNnDwgy62U-XZQWmZGg.text: Had lunch with my boss here... cafeteria style, salads... not bad but not awesome salads... but they sure are proud of them 2 salads and drinks came to over $30! So, would I go there again? Maybe, but I haven't. I'm not intending on putting it in my normal rotation.

bMz_RekC2YL2IWXuEhJ8KQ.text: I had their special on the board which was brown rice, korean beef bbq, salad, and chicken veggie soup. I also ordered salad and steak for my bf. Lets start with the meal I ordered. The brown rice had too much water in it. It was very mushy which was a waste because I didn't even bother eating it after. Korean bbq was cooked medium well which is how I like it. It was tasty and delish. Salad was great, veggies were fresh and it came with a salad dressing which tasted like the in and out sauce. Very yummy. My bf salad was good also and his steak was also cooked medium well. Everything we ordered was great besides the rice I wish they would have cooked it better. It's okay though the service was awesome. Overall this place wasnt too bad knowing its in the southside phoenix area..

NUYXsVmuB9cLekCUJGBPTQ.text: My husband and I came here from PHX airport looking for a healthier lunch option in the area...you know when you just really want a sandwich or a salad instead of burgers and fries? We chose GreenMix because it wasn't a far drive and we could get our meal to go.   There was nobody in the eatery. Sure it was the Saturday before Mother's Day at 11:45 am, but I was surprised to not see any other customers. Oh well, it gave us the opportunity to get a personal welcome by a nice Asian lady who showed us what the menu had to offer. She even asked where we were from and was overall friendly and motherly!  As for the environment, the tables and chairs were very clean (in fact, the lady that greeted us was wiping down the windows when we came in). There's no grimy feel about this place.   On another note, there was just one girl working in the back making our order. I imagine if you come on a busier day you might have to wait awhile for your food. It took ours about 8-10 minutes with no one else coming in while we were here.   What we ordered: -Green Chicken Sandwich ($7.95): contains grilled chicken, spinach, avocado, green apple, smoked Gouda, and chipotle dressing - also comes with side salad -Honey Walnut Chicken salad ($9.95): has grilled chicken, green apple, walnuts, feta, & chickpeas on a bed of spinach with honey walnut vinaigrette  Listen to what everyone has said and go with the Green Chicken sandwich!! Soft bread, great textures with the apples inside, juicy chicken, and just a little too much creamy chipotle dressing. The salad was good, fresh ingredients, and again, juicy chicken with little pops of flavor from the walnuts!  I like what they've done in creating new flavor combos and yet there's also an option for create-your-own sandwich or salad. I'd recommend this place for fresh sandwiches and salads with a tasty twist. Skip Subway (which happens to be right next store) and find a new sandwich to fall in love with (I'm going to try to recreate this at home in NorCal!).

GnLtWeRKAMdUo3c0jb_jvQ.text: Great restaurant! i highly recommend everyone to eat here. i tried the new summer fried chicken and it was amazing, nice friendly staff and environment.

abZOON75mM4HNXj_8J9jdg.text: I'm a salad lover. Recently when I was headed to an area of town I'm almost never in, I checked for something new and was pleasantly surprised to see one I'd never seen before - GreenMix! Sweet!   What the pleasant girl at the register said to me was: "Hi! How are you doing? What can I get for you?"  What I wish she had said was: "Hi! Hey, before you order, I want to make sure you understand that it might take us upwards of an hour to make your two salads, and the minute you hand your cash over to me, you won't be able to get a refund - even if we haven't started to THINK about making your salads - you're going to be totally screwed and we're going to take your money - so like, is that cool?"  Because my answer would have been no that's not cool, that's stupid, what the hell is wrong with you.   But that didn't happen.   Instead, I ordered my salads and she brightly said "we'll have that out to you as quickly as possible!" I then went and sat in the waiting area. For thirty minutes. For two salads (that didn't come). Not only did they not come, they had not even been started yet (the people who had been in front of me in line were also still foodless and confused), and I was out of time. So I returned to register girl and I tell her that I have to go. I do this in a tone of voice that attempts to convey to her that I'm deeply disappointed I couldn't get a salad made in under an hour - but she looks at me blankly as if I had just spoken a secret moon language. She throws up her hands as if to ask "well what do you want me to do?"  Really? You have no idea what I might want? I paid $25 for two salads that you haven't yet started making, yet you're just left with NO IDEA? What could it be? WHAT COULD IT BE  "I want you to give me my money back."  GASP  For a moment, she recoils in horror... but she recovers almost instantly.   "Oh, I can't give you a refund," she says.  No hint of her earlier hesitation and frustration. This girl knows one thing in all the world and it is this: she can NOT give me a refund.  "I can give you store credit."  My jaw dropped. You haven't even started to make my salads, I've cost you absolutely nothing (and you've cost me basically my whole lunch hour) - but you can't give me my money back?  I gamely attempt to explain that store credit is useless when you'd rather gnaw off your own leg than come back, but as you might imagine, this gets me nowhere. My wallet $25 lighter, I left the restaurant hungry, never to return. Buyer beware. The way I see it these people straight up stole $25 from me.   PS: IT'S A SALAD PEOPLE WHAT THE HELL

88TSiXHXfeeB66iFf-oUBA.text: The food here tastes amazing! I ordered the c square and I was so full just after the sandwich. My party also ordered the Hawaiian BBQ Chicken, Teriyaki Chicken and a build your own wrap. Worth the money! The staff was also really nice and the place was clean. **They do a spicey thai vinaigrette on their salads. We asked for something not spicey on one of the salads and they did a sesame orange vinaigrette which was also delicious.

kEEN5_Od_ymAMxx4yFvKvw.text: Pretty Good  We were looking for a spot for a light lunch and Green Mix fit the bill. My sister and I both enjoyed our salads. The ingredients are fresh, plentiful, and the selection is large enough for everyone to find something they would enjoy. Green Mix also serves panini and rice bowls.  I will have to give those a try on my next visit.  The staff are  friendly and engaging. The restaurant is clean and inviting. If you ever find yourself in the mood for a deliciously light lunch you have to try this place you won't be disappointed.

UXGH9-S34668TPk3PoPL7w.text: Update: ok GreenMix you won your 5th star today!  Very classily done too.  Today I had a new guy join me for lunch, beforehand the conversation went like this.  "Where are you taking us to lunch?"  "Salad place"  "Huh, guess I'll join"  This new guy, let's just say he doesn't seem to enjoy many salads in his meal times.   I came in with my party, ordered and was promptly delivered an array of awesome custom salads.   Everyone was thoroughly impressed with the selection and fresh taste of the salads.   Our server happen to mention that they have refinished their tables and pointed out to me that they weren't sticky, he was very proud,  and he should be.  Tables are great and no longer have a sticky touch to them.  He didn't mention seeing the review but that was the only thing I could really give a "con" remark to on my original Yelp review at GreenMix.    Outstanding! Here is a business that pays attention to their reviews and makes the necessary changes for their customers.  Thank you... see you soon.

69f-ftqep5jegMt_hL8I1Q.text: Looking for some vegan options for lunch today.  This place did not disappoint.  The food was fresh and cooked perfectly.  The staff were very friendly and welcoming.  Thanks for a great healthy lunch!

X_hO631E-pxrIrKWYRr5-g.text: Nice healthy selection of salads, paninis, wraps and Hawaiian BBQ. You also have the option to build your own salad. I went for the Asian BBQ beef salad and am glad I did! Spring mix, jicama, carrots, orange, breadcrumb and a delicious spicy ponzu vinegerette! The cashier also recommended the C Square which can be served as a salad or sandwich. If you're in the area, they are worth it for lunch!! About $9-15.

JWt4PKnM91Glc3bJ8nJ2nw.text: First time here.  Ordered the daily special which was a salad with either shrimp, chicken or beef on side with sesame chili sauce.  A scoop of rice as well.  The dressing on their salad was their own creation.  The salad was bright green and fresh and crunchy.  We ate in and it was bright and clean.  I would definitely go back and try something else.

w_bIKNi3KNEuEyc9VtyxrA.text: This is one of the best salad restaurant I ever visited. We ordered a mango shrimp salad and a streak wrap, both are very delicious. 4mlJwqyg05ee2ofHJsZFPQ.text: Upon entering the atmosphere was very welcoming. The staff was incredibly friendly and well informed of their menu items. The food range is amazing, can satisfy anyone's cravings! If you're looking for a place with healthier eating choices, this is the one. The salads are large and fulfilling, And their sandwhiches will send your taste buds on a flavorful journey until the very end. Scarlette was the best part of my experience. Her energy was uplifting and her customer service exceeded what I get from other places. I'm grateful my friend told me about this place, with the options it offers it makes healthy eating easy.

32jO7FvZMOfGiaLkNK0ehw.text: This is my 2nd time coming here only this time I did the take out as opposed to sitting down and enjoying the salad. Not too bad. I think they give you a little bit more when you eat in and they might actually cut the chicken up for you in smaller pieces. Still not a bad place to go,  I might go back who knows, dont get me wrong the salad is good, I was just a little disappointed in the size for the price for take out.

sOb7bnOCo_I4hA1D_KFnug.text: While I really, REALLY used to love going to Green Mix, I can't seem to bring myself back after noticing a few less than sanitary practices the last time I was there.  While waiting for my order, I sat and watched several other orders being prepared. To my disdain, I noticed the cook had dropped a piece of steak on the floor; however, while in the motion of picking it up she noticed me watching and instead left it there.  I swear it looked as if she were going to throw it back on the grill! Secondly, while exiting the restaurant, I stopped to fill my cup of water with a few lemons and saw a cockroach-- yes cockroach-- crawling out of the lemons!!!!! I didn't cause a scene although, I felt like fainting, and instead brought it to the attention of the lady that's generally there when I go in.  I understand "things happen" but I just can't seem to go back.  I've always enjoyed the salads and never really had any other complaints.  ***This experience took place nearly one year ago***

Z6wa8xSmF5JeK0DHW9_tyA.text: This place is excellent I had the shrimp salad with chipotle dressing and it was light but flavorful and filling.

-kE8EsZTunDDA5k96VdrYg.text: Salads are large enough, with a full chicken breast included. Will definitely be back to try more of the salads and sandwiches.  If you get the burritos get the sauce on the side.  Much too much sauce to be enclosed in the burrito.

gVY0_wVtBcUr_GyWaZLLTw.text: Came here with my Boyfriend Wanting to eat something healthy and was not disappointed! Had a yummy FRESH Steak Salad! And he had a Honey Walnut Chicken salad ! Great service!!! Will be back again!!!

QiIgZGdJmVWE6nPfHcWFOw.text: I like! Owners have a great personality. If you're really hungry probably not the best spot. It's a little pricy for the amount of food but the food you do receive is GREAT.

gEjlJMAZrQ72HTtMOwnBMw.text: A great find in Phoenix for fresh, gourmet salads, paninis and rice bowls.  I had the Shrimp salad with chipotle dressing, mangos and avacados and it was delicious.  It's nice to have a healthy option for lunch or dinner without having to sacrifice taste.  I can't wait to go back and try the Chicken Salad and Steak panini

t-tMbAfwjYQ9HyQ_z8x2EQ.text: I just finished eating here while I waited for my husband who works nearby to get off work.  I was pleasantly surprised!  I got the C-squared panini which is well seasoned grilled chicken, bacon, greens, avocado, blue cheese and a lemon aioli.  It was delicious.  It also came with a side salad with some sort of yummy dressing (maybe a soy dressing) and that was delicious as well.  Everything looked and tasted fresh!  I will definitely be going back within the next couple days to try more of their menu.  If you are a salad/sandwich lover such as myself, then you will absolutely love this place!

mbLOiZdfXDICNKVSmJm4zw.text: Terrific fresh salads and excellent grilled chicken and shrimp.  My wife and I really enjoy their food.  It's a welcome addition to an otherwise sparse selection of good non-chain restaurants in South Phoenix.

vaX4UdcnMnYvi6-wy1C8_w.text: Both things we tried were to die for. Even bought a large container of the house dressing to take home. Fresh ingredients. Chicken cooked perfectly!

XOR_L2py0BwpKie2OCebTw.text: The Valley could use more fresh in and out options like this! While in Downtown Phoenix for a meeting this weekend, lunch hour hit and I needed a healthy meal on the run. Enter GreenMix! As I walked in, I experience a bit of menu anxiety since it was my first visit and I wasn't sure what to expect. However, the staff was friendly and once they learned I was a first timer, the guy walked me through the steps. I decided to go with a salad, so I first choice the type of greens, followed by four additions from the bowls filled with veggies and cheese. This salad would be $5.99. They also had other bowls full of avocado, eggs, etc. However, those were 75 cents extra per topping. I'm a sucker for avocado so I decided it was work the three quarters. I also ended up adding chicken which was another $2. I ended up walking away with a hefty salad and soda for under $10. It's not cheap, but worth it for a fresh salad topped with added items! I will definitely visit again and keep my finger's crossed that they will open up more locations in the Valley.

kxOXptejodl8ZqLckR4oMw.text: Ok, I've only had one of these salads so far (Thai Shrimp) but it's ridiculously delicious!  I highly suggest this place if you want a decently sized, fresh salad.  So much better than the same ole ranch or cesar salad!

8t-GpXLo1isSFCK7C0Jm3g.text: A good place!  Didn't blow my mind, but wasn't bad.... I had a sandwich with a side salad.  It was all very fresh and very good! Very healthy.  I would definitely come back here again, although I felt like it was slightly over priced.

Tlu42hAsVDRQ2Td4ZaKM3g.text: I really could not believe the quality of food for the price. I had the steak panini with gouda cheese instead of the bleu. The chipotle sauce is fantastic and the panini bread is just right, not too thick and toasted just enough to still be soft. I signed up for Yelp just to review this place. We will definitely be frequenting this place!

RHVc-QrGJLGnIRU_Ukz5nw.text: Salads are great and the steak is awesome! But little on the pricey side.

9aUtpS1Xw1LJXi1rbAUlIA.text: This is a wonderful place! The atmosphere is great, the food is out of this world fresh and wonderful. Had the Asian Chicken Salad and was blown away by the presentation and the price. If you want a gourmet meal that looks good, tastes good, at a great price I highly recommend GreenMix. John the owner like Jay V. said really makes everyone feel very welcome, and one of the sweetest person's you will ever encounter.   Keep up the great job!!

giUxX9o-56LRUExO3-rLtA.text: They have fresh salads and really good chicken rice bowls that include an over easy egg.  It is pricy, but you pay for what you get.  Fresh food comes at a price and this is the place to go for a change when eating out.

jiF2Gr33ziQ8pSxWh7vfAA.text: Quite possibly the worst ordering system in the history of earth.  The written out pencil and paper menu system is pointless and wastes time.  The food is just okay, about what you'd expect out of strip mall fare.  Staff was a family and they were all rude if you asked for any deviation or change from their menu items (No onions got a scowl).  Way overpriced for what you get.

OT8vcHaUGQDATxoyPn783A.text: I had a honey-walnut salad that was bland and overpriced.  I ordered a can of Arizona Iced tea that had a label stating 99 cents but they told me it was $2.50.  I'm pretty sure that is not legal.  I won't go back.

CrmBwRp1snINvgzR0LDWMw.text: Great find!  Was in the area visitng friends and stopped by Greenmix.  Had a BLTC (love the lemon herb aioli), and of course ate some of my friend's seared tuna salad.  So many cool looking cool things on the menu, wish I could try more.

NWFOfZuMAjLst675IaElaA.text: Delicious. We first stopped here and I was terrified as i hate salad places usually. I've tried all of their paninis now and love them. The one with gouda cheese is a little heavy on the gouda, which I never thought I would hear myself say. The ginger dressing they add to their side salad is delicious. I go and have to make myself try something besides the Seared Tuna.

X5G5X4l979KIOTqJbnFt5g.text: This place is near my job. It is one of the few restaurants that I can eat at in the area, between my refusal to eat animal products and a gluten intolerance. I have eaten here over a dozen times. I agree with previous reviews that it is overpriced, but I have let that go as it is locally owned and fresh produce can add up.   HOWEVER, twice a single staff member has spilled on me when cleaning up. The first time she spilled salad dressing on my lap and did not seem to realize it. She gave me a strange look when I asked for another napkin. Once she realized it she did apologize. The second time she spilled someone else's ice on my feet and purse. I got a muttered apology with no eye contact. I waited a few minutes to see if someone would do something to try to keep my business. I am a  regular and it was the second spill. No one approached me so I left.   I do believe that the young woman is a nice person. She seemed embarrassed, but the staff have poor customer service skills.  Also, I believe that they substitute greens without informing the customer. Once I ordered romaine and believe I got iceberg. Same thing when I ordered butter lettuce. If you want real greens ask for spinach or the mixed greens.  I admire the effort to open a healthy restaurant in South Phoenix. I wish this place was managed better...

G2OH7DGweUytit9m3fIBJg.text: I had the daily special with Grilled Tuna. It comes with Rice, Salad and a soup. Really good.  Staff was very nice.  A couple of regulars were coming in, and by their reactions there must be other things on the menu that are great.  I'll be back!

g8WBDfqUVgxYa32Y6wathw.text: All I can say is go and order the Korean Beef salad, OMG.... Soooooo good! Even my daughter's grilled chicken panini was on point, she ate all her chicken and feel asleep!! ;) Food is freshly prepared, even the salad dressing!! YUMMO!!!!!!

ersmQ61-9B1-BGSYvpq9dg.text: Love this place. I could eat here everyday. Congratulations on opening the new location but I miss John!!!!

Its a little more out of the pocket than the normal lunch but for what you get, i think its worth it.

Now that we moved back to the area, I am excited to be near Green Mix again. I usually get the green apple chicken panini and my husband gets the jumbo shrimp panini-a must try!

It is in a strip mall at Baseline and 24th St in the Fry's shopping center.  When you walk in, the restaurant has a very comfortable feel.  Reviewing the menu, the entire menu reveals food that is incredibly heathy not to mention tasty.  This family owned restaurant makes you feel welcome as soon as you walk it.  I don't know about the majority of people around town, but I, for one, love to support local business in lieu of corporate chains.  What can I tell you, beside being very comfortable and friendly, the food is INCREDIBLE!!!  I had the Thai Shrimp salad which was an incredible experience of flavor.  Would I return here to eat again???  You bet I would!  In a heart beat!  Thank you for an incredible first experience!  :)

a35Eh79jE8d7N3Z26j7g3A.text: Went here for lunch the other day after hiking on South Mountain.  It feels like a slightly nicer Subway restaurant when you walk in, the place is very brightly decorated and cheery.  THe reason I am writing this review is for the Farm hot pressed panini.  FIrst off it's not technically a panini more like hot toasted sandwich.  I had never had a squash sandwich before, but it was really good.  The break was toasty and fresh and the vegetables were cooked perfectly.  If you are near this place for lunch stop in and have one.  The price is a bit on the high side for a sandwich shop, but it was really good.  Try:  - The Farm Sandwich

I love their dressings, though some can be too spicy for my taste.  You can customize anything however you want.  Some people complained about price and portion size, but I don't think either is out of line.  I'd much rather support a local family restaurant than a big chain.

HFlv10y3uS9dPgPtgIX3oA.text: This place is delicious. I'll admit has a very unique taste but it's wonderful I'm very big on customer service and I had such a great experience keep it up guys.

sssgHf5MhEljBeIRh9OA0A.text: This place is more than just salads! My fiance and I came here for a light lunch because we knew we were going to have a heavy dinner. She got a smoked turkey panini and I got a fiesta shrimp panini and split it so we each had half. Both were excellent! Every panini comes with a side salad with their delicious house dressing and everything is made fresh by a very friendly staff. We'll definitely be back!

RgxRAWt2Qigjp7_c3h4mNw.text: Food was good! Proportions are small for a restaurant in the USA but they filled you up! The re were only two people working, I think it was the owners, so we waited about 10 min for our food but you can see them preparing the food from scratch. That to me, I would pay a little bit more money for fresh prepared food.   The place was clean! The kitchen was clean! Very friendly! I would definitely  go back again!!

o3PoGtfAatpe3b-Q_lIi1A.text: Tried for the first time today. Will not be coming back. Rice bowls have no flavor, rice is extremely bland . Chicken is dry. Awkward silence in the restaurant, count at least play soft music. Overall very unsatisfactory.

Hy5bnj2eBSAQ_SzTHFZPcQ.text: I had lunch here a few weeks ago and Yelp reminded me to review this place. Food was really tasty. I had the Korean BBQ salad. The price was absurd for a salad. It was like $12 with a drink... I think. I was hungry like two hours later. Good food, high price, slow service is how I would review this place.

Iyhq5gH_afkfatFICOkQ6A.text: This place is a True oasis in the middle of shopping bleakness. And it's got a nice outdoor patio as well, along the little walking path between the monstrous box stores. Stop in and take a break be glad you did. The price is a bit more than you might pay for much lower quality food -- deal with it. They have excellent healthy ingredients. Plus it is a very nicely laid out and designed restaurant, a comfortable place to relax. Plus you can get free wifi from the box store nearby, what more do you want in a daily restaurant.   The specials are great. That's all I get, because I have trouble deciding on anything else. But go for it -- I think the specials are a GREAT deal because you get to start out with the best healthiest tastiest somewhat spicy chicken-and-cabbage soup in the land.

xV75McbGC6XvMkoV7xlMBQ.text: I ordered the chicken plate. It was delicious, I will come back again for sure. Fresh ingredients and good call ahead service. Order was correct and had decent portions.

osGiTA2hY7mO5hozWxqNLQ.text: My husband and I visited this place while on vacation in AZ. We both created our own salads with romaine lettuce and other toppings. The romaine was not fresh and green as expected. The other toppings were ok but we felt as if we could have created a better salad at home. We wasted $20 at this place...will not be returning.

aUAakVi6Gi8tzVuSDcAvUA.text: Stopped in with a friend and we thought the food was wonderful!  We shared a fresh made salad and a tuna panini.  The portion size was good sized, in fact, we took half the sandwich home.  I would definitely come back!

W-gvCjFK-bszC3w6lgizug.text: Nice salad and they did not overcook the steak. Wife and I both enjoyed the tea selections and the crab Rangoon appy.

bYB-NSVNJQ23A0nxkFPJzQ.text: Went here seeking a tasty salad and I got what I wanted.  The guy working there was super nice. I was saying I wanted the Asian Chicken salad because the idea of Panko bread crumbs sounded really good, but I also didn't want a salad with meat on it. He had me get the Happy Veggie and added Panko to that. Then when he brought it out he brought me both the dressing for the Happy Veggie and the Asian Chicken. So nice!  My Happy Veggie was super tasty. They put seasonal veggies on there and they were great. I loved both dressings but the Asian Chicken salad one was my favorite.  My husband tried a flatbread that involved a fried egg. He was a fan.  I love a restaurant with tasty food and nice people working.

HVQ2fONscU7Nogil-98quQ.text: Found this while looking for a quick, healthy, and reasonably priced place to grab dinner. That's exactly what I found, the price is decent and the food was definitely geared to toward the healthy side, and there isn't much of that around that area. Salads were fresh with plenty of options to choose from. Will certainly be going back there when I'm back in Phoenix.

FyzdBvHoK9S7E5CC3arDOA.text: By far the most tender and juicy Korean BBQ beef I've ever had. I said I was hungry so she recommended the panini. Very good decision. So freaking delicious.

465pJoQNGgcr2D_YMx0bAw.text: Food is good; however, they skimp so much on ingredients, you feel like you're getting totally ripped off. The nickel and dime you for everything....not worth the price and won't be back.

7JPknV28xhje_9p8vvarRQ.text: I wish I could give it less stars. I went here because I was so sure I could get something that was gluten-free and dairy-free.  If you have food allergies, DO NOT GO HERE. They cannot tell you what is in their salad dressings. I tried to explain that I had food allergies in a very simple way, and was refused an ingredient list. She said they did not have one and she did not know what was in their "homemade" dressings.   Homemade my ass.  I left. I detest Applebee's but they were much more accommodating.

iZZf1ek9mztyQHrpAOspxw.text: Delicious food...explosive flavors a must try if ur in so. Mountain area...had the Fiesta shrimp panini and my honey had the Korean bbq panini...yum yum...please try

D4zAhoPSEjmUwDiZuTo8KQ.text: I love having a healthy alternative to "fast food" in our area.  However, I do agree with some of the other reviews that for the price, the portions seems small and they are indeed stingy with the toppings.     I went with a friend and I ordered the Chicken Cobb Salad for $8.49.   It's served with a full chicken breast, but I had to search for the bacon, blue cheese, and the slivers (I'm not kidding when I say "slivers") of egg.     They have a wide selection of dressings, which if it's not the busy  the owner will let you try.   The Honey Walnut Vinaigrette is bland, but the Spicy Ponzu Vinaigrette is wonderful (an asian-inpsired sweet sesame), and I enjoyed the Herb Balsamic Vinaigrette (which I subbed on my salad for the Lemon Ranch Herb dressing).  As a side note, but my husband was thrilled to see they served coke in a glass bottle!  I hope the owners read these reviews and try to modify their approach to be a little more generous with their toppings.    Still, I'm thrilled to have a healthy alternative like Salads to our area in South Phoenix!!!

nRzHmmsX-BrCl4M4gwS-Og.text: Wife and I ate at Green Mix and it was yummy fresh food.  The green mix tuna panini was great and the signature dressing was yummy.  Now I just need to get them to open one in San Diego.

qUbjVqMr_O-LQi-xqATJ6w.text: I didn't expect it to be THAT tasty! I ordered the GreenMix Tuna Panini that comes with a small side salad...wow, it was heaven from the first bite to the last. I'm definitely coming back here with my fiance soon. I might even come here once a week for my lunch break.

dX2mRMq4M4xu_UvYxEHCBw.text: This is our go-to healthy spot! The food is always fresh and delicious, and the service is always super friendly. Can be a little pricey but it's definitely worth it. It can be more of a lunch place, so on nights and weekends there's not much of a wait.

W7yJt7tg2aUD3M79r7SFiA.text: Good but the portion for the salads are really really small. I feel like the lettuce is all gone after 4 folks bites.

4D75hTnpJ5fV5mmvIhRcyw.text: I've been here twice now, and both times my meals were really tasty.  The first time I had the Thai shrimp salad, and the second time I had the Korean Beef BBQ wrap (it's listed as a sandwich, but you can get any salad or sandwich as a wrap instead, which is a nice touch).  The Korean BBQ wrap was REALLY delicious!  However, I would have preferred the red onions to have been cut into thinner slices -- I'm not a fan of chunks of red onion.  So I just picked some of them out and continued to enjoy my wrap.    However, I have to agree with other reviewers that the portion sizes do not match the prices.  $10 for a wrap is a bit on the high side, especially for a fast food alternative.  With Subway next door selling $5 footlongs, they might want to consider lowering their prices if they're trying to attract the fast food crowd.

geELzwAuiTjmFPd7eJ7Olg.text: I knew it was going to be a good place when i discovered that they had the softest toilet paper of any restaurant I've ever frequented. I had the shrimp and mango salad. The shrimp was fresh and cooked perfectly. The salad ingredients were also very fresh although not particularly innovative. The dressing was really flavorful (I had the greenmix dressing). The only issue I have is the price. 12.00 for a salad seems steep. But if I paid extra for the Charmin and the clean environment, it was worth the extra couple bucks.
